seg-source.mrk: Path user defined functions Reference

target.mrk: Path user defined functions Reference

trans-unit.source: Below is a complete list of the user defined functions available in AutoIt. Click on a user defined function name for a detailed description.

Click on a user defined function name for a detailed description.

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_AbortPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_AbortPath

trans-unit.source: Closes and discards any paths in the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: Closes and discards any paths in the specified device context

target.mrk: Closes and discards any paths in the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_BeginPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_BeginPath

trans-unit.source: Opens a path bracket in the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: Opens a path bracket in the specified device context

target.mrk: Opens a path bracket in the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_CloseFigure

target.mrk: _WinAPI_CloseFigure

trans-unit.source: Closes an open figure in a path

seg-source.mrk: Closes an open figure in a path

target.mrk: Closes an open figure in a path

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_EndPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_EndPath

trans-unit.source: Closes a path bracket and selects the path defined by the bracket into the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: Closes a path bracket and selects the path defined by the bracket into the specified device context

target.mrk: Closes a path bracket and selects the path defined by the bracket into the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_FillPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_FillPath

trans-unit.source: Closes any open figures in the current path and fills the path's interior by using the current brush

seg-source.mrk: Closes any open figures in the current path and fills the path's interior by using the current brush

target.mrk: Closes any open figures in the current path and fills the path's interior by using the current brush

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_FlattenPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_FlattenPath

trans-unit.source: Transforms any curves in the path that is selected into the current DC, turning each curve into a sequence of lines

seg-source.mrk: Transforms any curves in the path that is selected into the current DC, turning each curve into a sequence of lines

target.mrk: Transforms any curves in the path that is selected into the current DC, turning each curve into a sequence of lines

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_PathToRegion

target.mrk: _WinAPI_PathToRegion

trans-unit.source: Creates a region from the path that is selected into the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: Creates a region from the path that is selected into the specified device context

target.mrk: Creates a region from the path that is selected into the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_StrokeAndFillPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_StrokeAndFillPath

trans-unit.source: Closes any open figures in a path, strokes the outline of the path, and fills its interior

seg-source.mrk: Closes any open figures in a path, strokes the outline of the path, and fills its interior

target.mrk: Closes any open figures in a path, strokes the outline of the path, and fills its interior

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_StrokePath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_StrokePath

trans-unit.source: Renders the specified path by using the current pen

target.mrk: Renders the specified path by using the current pen

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_WidenPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_WidenPath

trans-unit.source: Redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked

seg-source.mrk: Redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked

target.mrk: Redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked
